messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] attitude adjustment - totally selfindulgent
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s been 18 months since the kids left school but not quite that long since I ve made a conscious effort to quit trying to control every little thing. I
messages.messageBody:
> I think we're basically still in a deschooling/de-stressing phase here.
It's been 18 months since the kids left school but not quite that long since
I've made a conscious effort to quit trying to control every little thing.
I have a long way to go and I hope the kids don't get jerked around by me
too much. I guess they can't get jerked if I make the leash long enough can
they???

It's got to be better for them than school, especially since you're trying
so hard to deal with your own issues.
>
> Anyway I've rambled again.

I quite enjoy your rambling, Lee-Ann.
Tia
leschke@...

"Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where
there is no path and leave a trail."
- Ralph Waldo Emerson
